intro: Galium fontanesianum, commonly known as the Fontanesian bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often form dense mats. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the wet season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium fontanesianum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
